intro: Psychanthus myrtifolius, commonly known as the myrtle-leaved psychanthus, is a flowering plant native to tropical regions of Africa. It belongs to the family Rubiaceae, which includes coffee and gardenias. The plant is characterized by its glossy, dark green leaves that resemble those of myrtle, hence its common name. It produces small, fragrant flowers that are typically white or pale yellow. Psychanthus myrtifolius is often grown as an ornamental plant due to its attractive foliage and modest blooms.
